How to escape git merge message

Published on Mar 20, 2020

    I got stuck in the terminal today and was forced to restart it because when I tried to merge my latest changes Git told me I need to pull my master branch down. And when I did, this happened: I had never seen this before and I tried to type q/quit/enter. None of them worked. I turned to my good friend Google and googled around for a bit. And I realized it’s a process to escape this state. Here’s what I found:

    If you want to enter your own merge message you need to follow these two steps before the next:

    1. Press ‘i’ on your keyboard
    2. Write your merge message

    If you want to skip the merge message or you are finished writing your own merge message:

    1. Press ‘esc’ (escape)
    2. Write “:wq”
    3. Then hit ‘enter’

    Hope that was informative and help solved your issue! :)
    -Shunshun
